author: raxhvl
content: The mapping ensures the block is invalidated for the right reason. A warning might suggest it's non critical, but we canâ€™t be sure itâ€™s not a false positive. To be safe, itâ€™s better to fail the test.

author: draganrakita
content: Should we have BAL version somewhere in BAL? cc <@792404665068158998>

author: raxhvl
content:
It was discussed but later dropped because updates to BAL would need a fork and you could get the BAL version from the block number, see: https://github.com/raxhvl/pokebal/blob/main/analysis/compact-bal-encoding/summary.md#recommendation-version-and-compression-bytes

Do you see a performance boost from the version being in the BAL payload than deriving it from block number?

author: draganrakita
content: It feels more natural for version to be with BAL, but i see block number/fork point this can work.

author: raxhvl
content: Its just one additional byte so if folks feel strongly we can discuss in the next breakout. Also, we're better off having a version not knowing how to use it at this moment than not having a version and then having to get around that in the future.

author: draganrakita
content: I dont have exact preference, but have similar reasoning as you.

author: jwasinger
content: I'm against version because the BAL is tied to the block so it is implicitly "versioned" via the fork schedule.  But I'm not staunchly opposed to it, if someone can demonstrate that adding the version to the BAL has any use.

author: spencer_tb
content: Yeah not opposed. Although I'd rather it was a fail until it was checked. We've found live consensus issues in the past by checking the error messages.

author: draganrakita
content: One more edgecase test for selfdestruct on cold target that oog with insufficient gas for cold load.

Just want to update that it may take another day or so but I did not forget about this PR ðŸ™‚
